 Inlight is a 
   digital services business leveraging strategy, design and technology to solve complex and intriguing business challenges.    #goodhumans including designers, developers and strategists where you’ll hone your skills and discover the personal and professional growth to take your career to the next level.
  


 You’ll be driven by interesting work and collective success, working with smart people and pushing the boundaries of what our clients need and what technology can deliver.  The role



 We’re looking for an experienced 
   mobile developer to be involved in building exciting and complex digital products from conception through to delivery and work collaboratively with a talented team of developers.
  

    You’ll produce well structured-code that is valid, tested and of a high production standard and provide technical input to help guide our team and build trust and credibility with our clients. On a typical day, you’ll be driving your own work forward and work closely with our producers on technical planning and decisions, reviewing PRs and assisting other devs with technical questions and bug fixes. You should be able to contribute to new and innovative solutions whilst staying up to date with new technologies by experimenting, learning and improving.
  


 We work with a number of different technologies to suit the individual challenges faced by our clients.
  


 On the front-end, we favor React and NextJS, using both Javascript and Typescript. On the back-end, we enjoy using everything from serverless architecture to serving REST and GraphQL. APIs using NodeJS, to hosted CMS solutions using Craft CMS, MySQL, Docker and Lightsail.
  


 We use React Native for app development, as well as Swift and Java for hardware-specific solutions.
  


 Inlight utilises AWS products and infrastructure. We value experience with AWS, including Elastic Beanstalk, Cloudfront RDS, DynamoDB, and Lambda, as well as experience using Terraform, CDK and Serverless.
  

    Inlight is a Vercel partner, and any experience using Vercel or NextJS will be highly beneficial.
  


 Any further experience with caching, logging, monitoring, testing, deployment, or any other areas is a bonus. We understand we’re all on individual journeys so you may not have all the skills. That’s ok - we are always learning, and we hope that you are too.

Our job.    But we don’t just look for someone based on their skills and expertise. It’s our connection, acceptance and genuine care for each other that makes REA a great place to work. That means you also need to be:
 



 You love Android development (or desperately want to be an Android dev !), but with an open mind to working on iOS apps from time to time if the need arises
   


     Knowledge of software design patterns and best practices for software development
   


     Active contribution in technical decision-making process – we love hearing from every single person in the squad !

     Happy to ask questions and challenge the status quo
   


     An existing investment and ongoing commitment in your own learning and/or career change pathway (Hackathons, Short Courses and other Self-learning)
   


     A growth mindset - it's not about what you know but how you learn
   


     A focus on collaboration, communication and alignment with the REA values (see link for more info) - 
    
     https://www.rea-group.com/careers/rea-culture/our-values/
    



 The REA experience
 

   The physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our people is something we’ll never stop caring about. This is a place to learn and grow. We’re committed to your development – both professionally and personally. Your experience with us is something we take seriously.
 

 We offer:
 



     A flexible working environment, meaning we strike the balance of what you need and what works for the business (and yes, our leaders fully understand the benefits of working flexibly)
